alert.note: Alert for Bath (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 12:28AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Bath, Elliott, Estill, Fleming, Menifee, Montgomery, Powell and Rowan. In southeast Kentucky, Morgan and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1227 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Morehead, Stanton, Owingsville, Sandy Hook, Frenchburg, Marshall, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Clay City, Wellington, Sharpsburg, Salt Lick, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Young Springs, Midland, Farmers, Yale, Ratlitt and Cogswell.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
